text.front:
arXiv:cond-mat/0112448v1 [cond-mat.supr-con]
25 Dec 2001
Quasiparticle Excitation in the Superconducting Pyrochlore
Cd 2 Re 2 O 7 Probed by Muon Spin Rotation
Ryosuke Kadono * , Wataru Higemoto, Akihiro Koda, Yu Kawasaki 1 , Masashi
Hanawa 2 , and Zenji Hiroi 2
Institute of Materials Structure Science, High Energy Accelerator Research Organization (KEK),
Tsukuba, Ibaraki 305-0801
1 Graduate School of Engineering Science, Osaka University,
Toyonaka, Osaka 560-8531
2 Institute for Solid State Physics, University of Tokyo,
Kashiwa, Chiba 277-8581
( Received September 12, 2001
) Abstract
The quasiparticle excitations in the mixed state of Cd 2 Re 2 O 7 have been
studied by means of muon spin rotation/relaxation (µSR). The tempera-
ture dependence of the magnetic penetration depth (λ) is consistent with
a nearly isotropic superconducting order parameter, although a slight dis-
crepancy which is dependent on the details in the analysis may be present.
This is also supported by the relatively weak field dependence of λ.
* Also at School of Mathematical and Physical Science, The Graduate University for Advanced Studies
